original_title: Moving Pictures: Filmmakers and the Art of Cinematography
overview: In an intimate setting, camera people such as Roger Deakins, Vittorio Storaro, Rachel Morrison, Christopher Doyle, Rodrigo Prieto, Matthew Libatique and Mahmoud Kalari talk about their profession. World famous directors such as Ang Lee, Francis Ford Coppola and Wim Wenders also speak candidly about their special relationships with their cameramen or camerawomen. Their shared professional experiences – not limited to just the technical aspects – are intercut with illuminating film clips.
title: Moving Pictures: Filmmakers and the Art of Cinematography
